info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 11:44PM CDT until July 22 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing and expected to continue through the day Tuesday.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Osborne and Rooks.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - This Flood Warning replaces the previously issued Flash Flood Warnings issued for the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plainville, Osborne, Stockton, Natoma, Woodston, Alton, Zurich and Codell. - Some rivers and streams include the South Fork of the Solomon River, Medicine Creek, Kill Creek, Paradise Creek, Eagle Creek and Covert Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT TUESDAY
